Row.Text: You have visited all of the land and sea.
The entire world has been discovered.
You can not move here at this time.
That is the incorrect civic to select.
That is the incorrect governmnet to select.
That is the incorrect Great Person to select
That is the incorrect policy to select.
That is the incorrect technology to select.
Barbarians have learned of your presence.
Move your mouse to the screen location to complete.
Move your mouse to the screen location to accomplish.
Save your progress with a single click.
Settings for graphics, audio, key bindings, and more.
Retire from the game. This will count as a loss.
Exit to the Main Menu. You will lose any progress since your last save.
Exit the game completely. You will lose any progress since your last save.
Are you sure you wish to exit?
Are you sure you wish to quit your game?
Are you sure you wish to shutdown Sid Meier's Civilization VI?
Are you sure you wish to retire?
Player cannot affect the game during AutoPlay.
Other players are taking their turns, please wait...
A stacked unit must be moved.
You need to select a technology to research.
You need to select a civic to progress toward.
A policy in our government has grown obsolete and needs to be replaced.
The Civic you completed has unlocked a new Government. Consider changing to it this turn.
You conquered a city this turn. Decide whether to raze or keep it.
You need to select a Pantheon for your people.
You need to select a Religion for your people.
You have earned a Great Person, and need to choose whether to accept them or pass on them.
Your Spy has been detected! Local police forces have you on the run. Choose an escape route.
An enemy Spy has been detected! Choose which escape route to close off with your police forces.
Your Archaeologist needs to decide which civilization's [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifact he wants to return to his home Museum.
Your city can perform a ranged attack.
You need to select a unit or building to produce in your city.
Waiting for players to complete their turn.
You have units with [ICON_Movement] Movement points remaining. Click to end your turn now.
You have units with [ICON_Movement] Movement points remaining.
You have earned an [ICON_Envoy] Envoy, and may send it to a city-state for bonuses.
Unit is too damaged to conduct the attack
City is too damaged to conduct the attack.
Are you sure you want to remove your {1_UnitName} from the game?
Are you sure you want to launch a nuclear warhead?
Add this map pin to your chat text.
You need {1_num} more [ICON_Gold] in order to purchase this plot.
Claim this tile to be worked by this city, instead of your other city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ownership cannot be swapped if the tile has a district, a wonder, or is next to the other city's center tile.
Requires adjacent unit of the same type.
{1_Turns : plural 1?{1_Turns} turn; other?{1_Turns} turns;} until starvation.
{1_Turns : plural 1?{1_Turns} turn; other?{1_Turns} turns;} until growth.
{1_Turns : plural 1?{1_Turns} turn; other? {1_Turn} turns;} left until complete.
Districts, Buildings, Wonders, and Trading Posts.
Try improving the land around your city to obtain amenities.
Border expansion in {1_Turns : plural 1?{1_Turns} turn; other?{1_Turns} turns;}
Citizens are satisfied, no positive or negative effects.
Currently {1_num} out of {2_maxNum} specialists are working this tile.
No Trading Posts have been built.
The Pantheon Belief is the core Belief which holds for all cities in your civilization.
There are no religous citizens in your city at this time.
{1_Turns : plural 1?{1_Turns} turn; other?{1_Turns} turns;} until growth
{1_Turns : plural 1? {1_Turns} turn; other?{1_Turns} turns;} until a new citizen is born
{1_Turns : plural 1? {1_Turns} turn; other?{1_Turns} turns;} until a citizen is lost
{1_Turns : plural 1? turn; other? turns;} to complete
{1_Turns : plural 1? turn; other? turns;} until completed
{1_Turns : plural 1? turn; other? turns;} until growth
{1_Turns : plural 1? turn; other? turns;} until loss
This district has already been completed.
You've unlocked a new Belief for your Religion.
No suitable location to construct this.
The district is occupied by an enemy.
The required district is occupied by an enemy unit.
The city needs to grow to population {1_Population} before another district can be added.
No suitable location to zone this district.
No suitable location to zone this district.
The partially-constructed {1_District} in {2_CityName} must be completed (or dismantled) before you can start on another {3_District}.
Do you want to build a district here?
Do you want to build {LOC_GRAMMAR_A_AN << {1_DistrictName}} district here?
Do you want to build the {1_WonderName} wonder here?
Will remove the {1_Feature} on this tile.
Will remove the {1_Resource} on this tile.
Will remove the {1_Improvement} on this tile.
Will take an extra {1_ExtraTurnsUntilComplete} {1_ExtraTurnsUntilComplete : plural 1?turn; other?turns;} to complete (costs an extra {2_ExtraProductionCost} [ICON_Production] Production).
Will switch this tile's owner from {1_CityName} to this city.
Will add {1_Housing} [ICON_Housing] to the city based on the tile's Appeal of: {2_AppealName}
Corps and Armies require a Military Academy to build outright.
Your Civilization needs more [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity.
Your civilization needs {2_AmountNeededWithoutDistrict} {1_ResourceName} to train this type of unit. If this city has a {4_DistrictName}, you only need {3_AmountNeededWithDistrict} {1_ResourceName}.
Not enough {1_Resource} supply is available. Each unit alive or in production uses 1 supply, and each Owned or Imported resource in any city provides 4 supply.
The district required to train this unit is damaged.
The districts required to train this unit are damaged.
The district required to train this unit is contaminated.
The districts required to train this unit are contaminated.
The district required to train this unit is occupied by an enemy unit.
The districts required to train this unit are occupied by enemy units.
This city is at full capacity for aircraft.
This city needs at least {1_PopulationNeeded} [ICON_Citizen] Population.
Not enough [ICON_Gold] Gold in treasury to purchase this.
Not enough [ICON_Faith] Faith accumulated to purchase this.
Too many units of the same class in this location.
Required project location occupied by enemy unit.
Ah, 'tis good to finally to meet you! Rumors have travelled far and wide.
Allowing such a vulnerable unit to remain unprotected was not a wise choice.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your unit has been captured by {1_Civ}.
Another's poor decision has become your good fortune.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You have captured a unit from {1_civ}.
Commercial Hub and Harbor districts are the primary sources of [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity.
{1_EnvoysPerThreshold} [ICON_Envoy] {1_EnvoysPerThreshold : plural 1?Envoy; other?Envoys;} at {2_InfluencePointThreshold} Influence {2_InfluencePointThreshold : plural 1?point; other?points;}
Governments and policies are the primary sources of Influence points.
Policy and Government changes are free this turn
Click on a hex to place a map pin at that location.
Show majority religion and follower distribution across the map.
Shows geographic extent of each continent.
Shows appeal of each tile (for Neighborhoods, Seaside Resorts, National Parks).
Shows recommended city sites and water availability at each tile.
Shows distribution of governments across the map.
Show the number of Visiting Tourists in each tile.
{1_Turns : plural 1?{1_Turns} turn; other? {1_Turn} turns;} to completion.
No items are available to purchase with [ICON_Faith]Faith at this time.
No items are available to purchase with [ICON_Gold]Gold at this time.
A World Wonder Has Been Created!
Your civilization has finished construction on the [NEWLINE]{1_BuildingName}
A Space Race Project Has Been Completed!
An unmet civilization moves closer to Science Victory.
The villagers share a hidden technical secret.
While collecting knowledge from across the world you have discovered scientific wisdom unknown to your people.
The ingenuity of your great person has unlocked new scientific ideas.
Your Spy has stolen technology secrets from a Campus in a foreign city.
Your Research Agreement has come up with a scientific breakthrough.
Your research in {1_techString} is now complete!
Your knowledge of {1_techString} has advanced considerably.
The villagers share the secrets of their well organized community.
Collecting wisdom from across the lands in your library has yielded new ideas for your people.
The ingenuity of your great person has unlocked new ideas for your society.
Your development of {1_techString} is now complete!
Your progress toward {1_techString} has advanced considerably.
The world tracker is not currently displaying any panels. Toggle on panels from the menu button in the header.
Your people are enthusiastic to try this new form of government. Confirm the switch?
Having tried {1_GovernmentName} before, the people are wary of a return to this government. This change will plunge your nation into Anarchy for {2_Turns} turns.[NEWLINE]Confirm the switch?
Are you sure you want to close the menu?[NEWLINE]Policy changes have not been confirmed!
in {1_Turn} more {1_Turn : plural 1?turn; other?turns;} in a {2_Government}
Unlocks when the {1_CivicName} civic is completed.
No Wildcard Policy slots are provided by this government.
No Military Policy slots are provided by this government.
No Diplomacy Policy slots are provided by this government.
No Economic Policy slots are provided by this government.

Legacy bonuses are the learned benefits that stay with us as we progress through different systems of government. The learned policy symbol indicates a government bonus that will accumulate over time.
You have already founded a Religion.
{1_ArtifactName} must be returned to the home Museum in {2_CityName}.
Must be on your Holy Site district or Stonehenge wonder.
Fortification bonus applied to occupying unit.
Air base with {1_Amount} slots for aircraft.
Your Civilization needs {2_AmountNeeded} {1_ResourceName} to upgrade this type of unit.
Not enough {1_Resource} supply is available. Each unit alive or in production uses 1 supply, and each Owned or Imported resource in any city provides 4 supply.
Order the unit to fortify and sleep until it sees an enemy.
Must be on a valid National Park tile.
Must occupy district or wonder with a free slot of the proper Great Work type.
Requires an additional {1_GoldAmount} [ICON_Gold] Gold to activate.
Must be on a tile you own.
Must be on a tile no player owns.
Must be on a tile next to one you own.
City that owns this tile must be producing a Space Race project.
Must be on a tile with a Luxury resource.
Must be on a tile with no military units.
Must be on a tile with a military unit.
Must be on a tile with a military unit with the appropriate domain type for the great person.
Must be on a tile with a land military unit.
Must be on a tile with a naval military unit.
Must be next to a Barbarian unit.
Must be on a tile with a military unit of the appropriate military formation type.
Must be on a tile with a military unit that is not a Corps or an Army.
Must be on a tile with a Corps military unit.
Must be on a tile with an Army military unit.
Must be next to a Mountain.
Must be on or next to a natural wonder.
Must be on or next to {1_FeatureTypeName} plot.
Must be in a city with {LOC_GRAMMAR_A_AN_WITH_ICON << {1_GreatWorkObjectTypeName} << {2_IconString}} great work.
Must be on a wonder that is under construction.
Must have an open [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic great work slot in one of your cities.
Must be in a city without a {1_BuildingName} building.
A [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route in this tile belongs to a player you are not at war with.
A [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route in this tile has a special ability preventing it from being plundered.

This World Wonder has been constructed by another civilization, so we cannot complete it. But we can reclaim its raw materials, providing the city with {1_ProductionAmont} [ICON_Production] Production.
Bonus {1_ToYieldIcon} {2_ToYieldName} equal to the adjacency {3_FromYieldIcon} {4_FromYieldName} bonus of its district.
Cannot be built in the same district with {LOC_GRAMMAR_A_AN << {1_BuildingName}}
Must be adjacent to a river
Must be adjacent to a mountain
Must be built on a lake
Cannot be built on a lake
Government[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Unlocks when you complete the Code of Laws civic.
Government[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]View or manage your civilization's government choice and policies under that government.
+{1_Amenities} Amenities for this city while being worked.
Earn {1_YieldFontIcon} {2_YieldName} for your Civilization equal to {3_ConversionPercent}% of any [ICON_Production] Production contributed to this project.
Broke a diplomatic promise made to them
Kept a diplomatic promise made to them
Declared a surprise war on a friend
Declared a surprise war on an enemy
Decided to not make a diplomatic promise to them
Respects those with his religious building
Respects adding Faith/Culture to strong military
Respects empires with a lot of land
Pleased to see you fight lengthy wars honorably
Despises those who avoid war or capitulate for peace
Respects those who go to war and never capitulate for peace
Send an Archaeologist unit here to excavate an [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifact, which will provide [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism when brought back to your city.
{1_Amount: number +#,###;-#,###} [ICON_GreatWork_Landscape] Great {1_Amount : plural 1?Work; other?Works;} of Art {1_Amount : plural 1?slot; other?slots;}
{1_Amount: number +#,###;-#,###} [ICON_GreatWork_Writing] Great {1_Amount : plural 1?Work; other?Works;} of Writing {1_Amount : plural 1?slot; other?slots;}
{1_Amount: number +#,###;-#,###} [ICON_GreatWork_Music] Great {1_Amount : plural 1?Work; other?Works;} of Music {1_Amount : plural 1?slot; other?slots;}
{1_Amount: number +#,###;-#,###} [ICON_GreatWork_Religious] Great {1_Amount : plural 1?Work; other?Works;} of Religious Art {1_Amount : plural 1?slot; other?slots;}
{1_Amount: number +#,###;-#,###} Great Work {1_Amount : plural 1?slot; other?slots;} (holds any type)
Bonus {1_ToYieldIcon} {2_ToYieldName} equal to the adjacency {3_FromYieldIcon} {4_FromYieldName} bonus of its district.
Reach Access Level [ICON_VisSecret] OPEN in order to see hidden agendas.
Your mother was a hamster and your father smelt of elderberries. [NEWLINE] We are now at war.
To the last, I grapple with thee; [NEWLINE]From Hell's heart, I stab at thee;[NEWLINE]For hate's sake, I spit my last breath at thee.[NEWLINE]In other words, no.
Your Archaeologist {1_UnitName} has uncovered signs of an ancient conflict between {2_ActingCiv} and {3_TargetCiv}.
Your Archaeologist {1_UnitName} has uncovered signs of an ancient tribal village encountered by {2_ActingCiv}.
Your Archaeologist {1_UnitName} has found the remains of a barbarian camp dispersed by {2_ActingCiv}.
Your Archaeologist {1_UnitName} has discovered an ancient battlefield littered with items from {2_ActingCiv} and {3_TargetCiv}.
Your Archaeologist {1_UnitName} has found a wreck left by a naval battle between {2_ActingCiv} and {3_TargetCiv}.
The discovery appears to have been buried since the {1_EraName}.
CHOOSE which nation's artifact to uncover from this site.
After some study, it's been determined that this [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifact is from {1_ActingCiv}.
Accumulate {1_Number} [ICON_Faith] Faith to found a Pantheon.
Choose a new Belief to add to your Religion.
Earn a Great Prophet to start a full Religion (which adds 2 Beliefs).
Move your Prophet next to a friendly Holy Site or Stonehenge and select the Found Religion action.
Purchase an Apostle and have them take the Evangelize action to add another Belief.
None. Your Religion is fully developed.
Use an Apostle to evangelize a new belief.
(Choose a Religion from history, or choose a name and icon for a Religion of your own.)
You must have a Temple in a Holy Site district to purchase Apostles.
You must have a Shrine in a Holy Site district to purchase Missionaries.
This religion must have spent an Apostle to Launch Inquisition before purchasing Inquisitors. They are then purchased in a city with a Temple.
Apostles may convert [ICON_Citizen] Citizens to their Religion and initiate theological combat with units of other Religions.
Missionaries may convert [ICON_Citizen] Citizens to their Religion. May not initiate theological combat with units of other Religions (but can defend).
Inquisitors may eliminate the presence of other Religions in their territory, and initiate theological combat with units of other Religions.
Route Completed. Choose a new Route.
Move Unit to one of your City Centers.
Produce a Trader unit to use this Route.
Trading Post established with this city.
No Trading Post has been established with this city.
Total number of turns to complete this route.
Diplomatic visibility increased by [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route with this civilization.
Establish a [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route to increase diplomatic visibility with this civilization.
Bonus to [ICON_Tourism] Tourism due to [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes with this civilization.
Establish a [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route to get [ICON_Tourism] Tourism bonus with this civilization.

A [COLOR:NeutralCS]SCORE[ENDCOLOR] victory occurs when no civilization has achieved any other victory by the end of the game. In this case, the civilization with the overall highest [COLOR:NeutralCS]SCORE[ENDCOLOR] will win!
To achieve a [COLOR:ResScienceLabelCS]SCIENCE[ENDCOLOR] victory, you must accomplish 3 major milestones:
Land a human on the Moon.
How to attract Tourists to your civilization.

Your ability to attract [COLOR:ResCultureLabelCS]VISITING TOURISTS[ENDCOLOR] to your civilization is a function of the difference between your own [ICON_Culture] Culture production, and that of the civilization whose [COLOR:ResCultureLabelCS]DOMESTIC TOURIST[ENDCOLOR] you are attempting to attract.

To achieve a [COLOR:ResCultureLabelCS]CULTURE[ENDCOLOR] victory, you must attract [COLOR:ResCultureLabelCS]VISITING TOURISTS[ENDCOLOR] by generating high amounts of [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism. Victory is achieved when you attract more [COLOR:ResCultureLabelCS]VISITING TOURISTS[ENDCOLOR] to your civilization than any other civilization has [COLOR:ResCultureLabelCS]DOMESTIC TOURISTS[ENDCOLOR] at home.
Your [COLOR:ResCultureLabelCS]DOMESTIC TOURISTS[ENDCOLOR] represent the tourists from your civilization that are currently happy vacationing within your borders.
Your [COLOR:ResCultureLabelCS]VISITING TOURISTS[ENDCOLOR] represent the number of citizens you've attracted from the [COLOR:ResCultureLabelCS]DOMESTIC TOURIST[ENDCOLOR] pools of other civilizations.
How to attract Tourists to your civilization.
This column indicates how many of this civilization's tourists are still vacationing within their own borders.
This column shows how many tourists from this civilization are currently visiting us.
This column shows the total number of visiting tourists attracted to our civ out of the current total we need to achieve a Culture Victory.
To achieve a [COLOR:ResMilitaryLabelCS]DOMINATION[ENDCOLOR] victory, you must conquer the [ICON_Capital] Capital of every other civilization.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A strong military is highly recommended.

To achieve a [COLOR:ResFaithLabelCS]RELIGIOUS[ENDCOLOR] victory, your Religion must become the [COLOR:ResFaithLabelCS]PREDOMINANT[ENDCOLOR] Religion for every civilization in the game.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A Religion is [COLOR:ResFaithLabelCS]PREDOMINANT[ENDCOLOR] if it is followed by more than 50% of the cities in a civilization.
Add an [ICON_Envoy] Envoy between your civilization and this city-state.
You declared war against this city-state.
A direct declaration of war will destroy all of our [ICON_Envoy] Envoys here, and prevent us from sending others until peace is made. Any active quests will be canceled.

The Suzerain of this city-state can pay {1_GoldCost} [ICON_Gold] Gold to take temporary control of all its current military units. They will return to the city-state after {2_TurnLimit} [ICON_Turn] Turns, or if the Suzerain changes.
You have already levied the military of this city-state.
This city-state is aware of your civilization's existence.
Your civilization has a good relationship with this city-state. It will not declare war on you, unless it has a foreign Suzerain that does so.
Your civilization is the Suzerain of this city-state. You are receiving special bonuses, and the city-state will follow you into war and peace.

Your civilization is at war with this city-state. You do not receive any bonuses while at war, but as long as you were not the aggressor, you can still send [ICON_Envoy] Envoys to sway its allegiance.
View this city-state on the map.
You have not yet met a city-state.
Remove a proposed [ICON_Envoy] Envoy between your civilization and this city-state.
3 [ICON_Envoy] Envoys, and more than any other civilization:

Suzerain Diplomacy Bonus:[NEWLINE][ICON_Bolt]The city-state follows you into war and peace with other players.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bolt]Your units may enter city-state lands.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bolt]Your Builder units may improve city-state tiles.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bolt]See 3 tiles around the city-state.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bolt]Can pay [ICON_Gold] Gold to temporarily take control of the city-state's military.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bolt]Gain ownership of all the city-state's resources:
Currently at war.[NEWLINE](Peace possible in {1_Turns} {1_Turns:plural 1?turn; other?turns;}.)
Recently was at war.[NEWLINE](Declaring war is possible in {1_Turns} {1_Turns:plural 1?turn; other?turns;}.)
All individuals of this type have already been earned.
This Great Person has already been claimed!

If you do not wish to recruit this [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person, and would rather save your [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person points for a future opportunity, you can choose to pass. Passing costs {1_RejectCost} [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person points and cannot be undone. The points spent will apply as a discount to the [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person, allowing other players to acquire it for less points.

You can spend {1_FaithCost} [ICON_Faith] Faith on patronage and your current [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person points to immediately earn this [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person. The amount of [ICON_Faith] Faith needed is based on the difference between the number of points you have and the points needed to recruit the [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person normally.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You cannot perform this action if you or another player already has enough points to recruit the [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person, or if you have previously passed over the [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person.

You can spend {1_GoldCost} [ICON_Gold] Gold on patronage and your current [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person points to immediately earn this [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person. The amount of [ICON_Gold] Gold needed is based on the difference between the number of points you have and the points needed to recruit the [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person normally.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You cannot perform this action if you or another player already has enough points to recruit the [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person, or if you have previously passed over the [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person.

You have accumulated enough [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person points of this type to meet its cost, and can now spend {1_RecruitCost} points to recruit this [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person, immediately spawning it in your [ICON_Capital] Capital, or for the Great Admiral, your nearest coastal city.

{1_PointsPerTurn} {2_IconString} {3_GreatPersonClassName} {1_PointsPerTurn : plural 1?point; other?points;} per [ICON_Turn] Turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Points come primarily from districts and buildings, but can also come from world wonders and policies.
You have already earned the maximum allowed number of this type of Great Person.
You must have a coastal city center or a Harbor district in order to spawn a Great Admiral.
Another civilization has an active claim on this Great Person.
You have already chosen to Pass on this Great Person.
Your civilization trait ({1_TraitName}) prevents you from earning this [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person.
Your leader trait ({1_TraitName}) prevents you from earning this [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person.
Kick this player from the game.
Add this player as a friend on Steam.
Left click to look at pin. Right click to edit pin.
Left click to look at pin.
The game is waiting on you!
Estimated time until your next turn. Game desynchronization or players with slower machines can affect this estimate.
Estimated time has elapsed. This can occur due to game desynchronization or players with slower machines. Please wait.
YOUR CIVILIZATION HAS PRODUCED A GREAT WORK!
{1_name} ({2_type})[NEWLINE]Created by {3_author}[NEWLINE]Created in {4_date}[NEWLINE]Provides {5_providing} per turn when not themed.

{1_name} ({2_type})[NEWLINE]Created by {3_author}[NEWLINE]Created in {4_date}[NEWLINE]Provides 1 [ICON_Culture] Culture 1 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism per turn when authored by an artist who already has art displayed here.
{1_name} ({2_type})[NEWLINE]Created by {3_author}[NEWLINE]Found in {4_date}[NEWLINE]Provides {5_providing} per turn when not themed.
This slot can display Great Works of type:[NEWLINE]{1_works}
This {1_type} does not match the theme for this Museum. Add {2_type} from unique Great Artists to receive the bonus.
This {1_type} does not match the era for this Museum. Add {2_type} from unique civilizations to receive the bonus.
This building contains two or more Great Works created by {1_player}. Add {2_type} from unique civilizations to receive the bonus.
This {1_type} is establishing the theme for this museum.
{1_type} matching the theme for this Museum. Add one more work of this type to receive the theming bonus.
{1_type} matches the theme, but this Museum already has a Great Work from this artist. Add Great Works of the same theme, but from unique artists to receive the bonus.
[COLOR:ResCultureLabelCS]{1_building} is now themed. [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism are doubled.[ENDCOLOR]
Moved into this slot recently. Cannot be moved again for another {1_Turns} turns.
Artifacts may only be moved from full Archaeological Museums (those with no empty slots).
All available Trade Routes are in use.
{1_YieldAmount} {2_YieldIconString} {3_YieldName} from your [ICON_TradingPost] Trading Posts along the path.
Before you declare war, you may wish to consider the consequences.
Civilization that you will also go to war with:
{1_NumCS} city-state(s) will go to war against you.
{1_NumRoutes} incoming trade route(s) will be lost.
You are the last remaining human player in the game.
City-States[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]View all the city-states you've met, manage your [ICON_Envoy] Envoys, and review any bonuses earned.
Diplomacy[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]View information about the other civilizations you've met, manage your relationships, and make deals.
World Rankings[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]View the World Rankings to see how well you're doing, and what you need to do to win.
Trade Route Overview[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]View and manage your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes.
Tech Tree[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]View or manage your research.
Civics Tree[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]View or manage your civic focus.
Religion[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]View your Pantheon or Religion, as well as other Religions already established.
Great Works[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]View or manage the Great Works you've created.
Great People[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]View available [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People, as well as your progress towards earning a [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person.

Select items from your inventory to propose a trade.
Select items from their inventory to propose a trade.
Another deal with this player is pending.
Press the desired keyboard or mouse button you wish to bind. To cancel, click the Cancel button or press Escape. To clear the binding, click the Clear button.
Show or hide individual world tracker panels.

Drag and Drop a Policy to Slot it Here.
You have run out of time.
From our humble beginnings ages ago have you forged a civilization that has withstood time itself. Though countless civilizations rise and fall around us, we do not just survive. We prosper.
Much as our ancestors did ages ago, we thrust forward into the unknown. The first pioneers set forth on an uneasy course, and yet once again our people thrive.
We have a basic need to believe in something greater than ourselves. We crave solace in the darkness, a light unto our path. Thanks to you, weve found meaning amid the Cosmos.

The worth of a culture is not measured by its accomplishments, but in how those accomplishments last, and how they are remembered. The beauty that you have inspired our people to create will ensure that our culture stands for all time.
There are those who quibble whether power necessitates the will to use it. Whether violence begets only more violence. These questions are irrelevant. You, Great Leader, made it so.
Everyone else has lost... Therefore you've won!

Legacy bonuses are based on how long a government was active within your empire. When you switch to a new government, the Legacy bonus earned from the previous government remains with your civilization.
